Empires.name: Engineer
Empires.desc: Gain a card costing up to $4. You may trash this. If you do, gain a card costing up to $4.

Empires.name: City Quarter
Empires.desc: +2 Actions Reveal your hand. +1 Card per Action card revealed.)

Empires.name: Overlord
Empires.desc: Play this as if it were an Action card in the Supply costing up to $5. This is that card until it leaves play.)

Empires.name: Royal Blacksmith
Empires.desc: +5 Cards Reveal your hand; discard the Coppers.

Empires.name: Encampment
Empires.desc: +2 Cards +2 Actions You may reveal a Gold or Plunder from your hand. If you don’t, set this aside, and return it to the Supply at the start of Clean-up. (This is the top half of the Encampment/Plunder pile.)

Empires.name: Plunder
Empires.desc: $2 +1 VP (This is the bottom half of the Encampment/Plunder pile.)

Empires.name: Patrician
Empires.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Reveal the top card of your deck. If it costs $5 or more, put it into your hand. (This is the top half of the Patrician/Emporium pile.)

Empires.name: Emporium
Empires.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 When you gain this, if you have at least 5 Action cards in play, +2 VP. (This is the bottom half of the Patrician/Emporium pile.)

Empires.name: Settlers
Empires.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Look through your discard pile. You may reveal a Copper from it and put it into your hand. (This is the top half of the Settlers/Bustling Village pile.)

Empires.name: Bustling Village
Empires.desc: +1 Card +3 Actions Look through your discard pile. You may reveal a Settlers from it and put it into your hand. (This is the bottom half of the Settlers/Bustling Village pile.)

Empires.name: Castles
Empires.desc: See Castles section below.

Empires.name: Catapult
Empires.desc: +$1 Trash a card from your hand. If it costs $3 or more, each other player gains a Curse. If it’s a Treasure, each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. (This is the top half of the Catapult/Rocks pile.)

Empires.name: Rocks
Empires.desc: +$1 When you gain or trash this, gain a Silver; if it’s your Buy phase, put the Silver on your deck, otherwise put it into your hand. (This is the bottom half of the Catapult/Rocks pile.)

Empires.name: Chariot Race
Empires.desc: +1 Action Reveal the top card of your deck and put it into your hand. The player to your left reveals the top card of their deck. If your card costs more, +$1 and +1 VP.

Empires.name: Enchantress
Empires.desc: Until your next turn, the first time each other player plays an Action card on their turn, they get +1 Card and +1 Action instead of following its instructions. At the start of your next turn, +2 Cards.

Empires.name: Farmer’s Market
Empires.desc: +1 Buy If there are 4 VP or more on the Farmers’ Market Supply pile, take them and trash this. Otherwise, add 1 VP to the pile and then +$1 per 1 VP on the pile.

Empires.name: Gladiator
Empires.desc: +$2 Reveal a card from your hand. The player to your left may reveal a copy from their hand. If they don’t, +$1 and trash a Gladiator from the Supply. (This is the top half of the Gladiator/Fortune pile.)

Empires.name: Fortune
Empires.desc: +1 Buy When you play this, double your $ if you haven’t yet this turn. When you gain this, gain a Gold per Gladiator you have in play. (This is the bottom half of the Gladiator/Fortune pile.)

Empires.name: Sacrifice
Empires.desc: Trash a card from your hand. If it’s an… Action card, +2 Cards, +2 Actions Treasure card, +$2 Victory card, +2 VP

Empires.name: Temple
Empires.desc: +1 VP Trash from 1 to 3 differently named cards from your hand. Add 1 VP to the Temple Supply pile. When you gain this, take the VP from the Temple Supply pile.

Empires.name: Villa
Empires.desc: +2 Actions +1 Buy +$1 When you gain this, put it into your hand, +1 Action, and if it’s your Buy phase return to your Action phase.

Empires.name: Archive
Empires.desc: +1 Action Set aside the top 3 cards of your deck face down (you may look at them). Now and at the start of your next two turns, put one into your hand.

Empires.name: Capital
Empires.desc: $6 +1 Buy When you discard this from play, take [6D], and then you may pay off [D].

Empires.name: Charm
Empires.desc: When you play this, choose one: +1 Buy +$2; or the next time you buy a card this turn, you may also gain a differently named card with the same cost.

Empires.name: Crown
Empires.desc: If it’s your Action phase, you may play an Action from your hand twice. If it’s your Buy phase, you may play a Treasure from your hand twice.

Empires.name: Forum
Empires.desc: +3 Cards +1 Action Discard 2 cards. When you buy this, +1 Buy.

Empires.name: Groundskeepr
Empires.desc: +1 Card +1 Action While this is in play, when you gain a Victory card, +1 VP.

Empires.name: Legionary
Empires.desc: +$3 You may reveal a Gold from your hand. If you do, each other player discards down to 2 cards in hand, then draws a card.

Empires.name: Wild Hunt
Empires.desc: Choose one: +3 Cards and add 1 VP to the Wild Hunt Supply pile; or gain an Estate, and if you do, take the VP from the pile.

Prosperity.name: Loan
Prosperity.desc: $1 When you play this, reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Treasure. Discard it or trash it. Discard the other cards.

Prosperity.name: Trade Route
Prosperity.desc: +1 Buy Trash a card from your hand. +$1 per Coin token on the Trade Route mat. Setup: Add a Coin token to each Victory Supply pile. When a card is gained from that pile, move the token to the Trade Route mat.

Prosperity.name: Watchtower
Prosperity.desc: Draw until you have 6 cards in hand. When you gain a card, you may reveal this from your hand, to either trash that card or put it onto your deck.

Prosperity.name: Bishop
Prosperity.desc: +$1 +1 VP Trash a card from your hand. +1 VP per $2 it costs (round down). Each other player may trash a card from their hand.

Prosperity.name: Quarry
Prosperity.desc: $1. While this is in play, Action cards cost $2 less, but not less than $0.

Prosperity.name: Talisman
Prosperity.desc: $1. While this is in play, when you buy a non-Victory card costing $4 or less, gain a copy of it.

Prosperity.name: Worker’s Village
Prosperity.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions +1 Buy

Prosperity.name: City
Prosperity.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions If there are one or more empty Supply piles, +1 Card. If there are two or more, +$1 and +1 Buy.

Prosperity.name: Contraband
Prosperity.desc: $3 +1 Buy When you play this, the player to your left names a card. You can’t buy that card this turn.

Prosperity.name: Counting House
Prosperity.desc: Look through your discard pile, reveal any number of Coppers from it, and put them into your hand.

Prosperity.name: Mint
Prosperity.desc: You may reveal a Treasure card from your hand. Gain a copy of it. When you buy this, trash all Treasures you have in play.

Prosperity.name: Mountebank
Prosperity.desc: +$2 Each other player may discard a Curse. If they don’t, they gain a Curse and a Copper.

Prosperity.name: Rabble
Prosperity.desc: +3 Cards Each other player reveals the top 3 cards of their deck, discards the Actions and Treasures, and puts the rest back in any order they choose.

Prosperity.name: Royal Seal
Prosperity.desc: Worth $2 While this is in play, when you gain a card, you may put that card onto your deck.

Prosperity.name: Vault
Prosperity.desc: +2 Cards Discard any number of cards for +$1 each. Each other player may discard 2 cards, to draw a card.

Prosperity.name: Venture
Prosperity.desc: Worth $1 When you play this, reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Treasure. Discard the rest, then play the Treasure.

Prosperity.name: Goons
Prosperity.desc: +1 Buy; +$2 Each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. While this is in play, when you buy a card, +1 VP token.

Prosperity.name: Grand Market
Prosperity.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +1 Buy +$2 You can’t buy this if you have any Coppers in play.

Prosperity.name: Hoard
Prosperity.desc: Worth $2. While this is in play, when you buy a Victory card, gain a Gold.

Prosperity.name: Bank
Prosperity.desc: Worth $? When you play this, it’s worth $1 per Treasure card you have in play (counting this).

Prosperity.name: Expand
Prosperity.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $3 more than it.

Prosperity.name: Forge
Prosperity.desc: Trash any number of cards from your hand. Gain a card with cost exactly equal to the total cost in $ of the trashed cards.

Prosperity.name: King’s Court
Prosperity.desc: You may play an Action card from your hand three times.

Prosperity.name: Peddler
Prosperity.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 During your Buy phase, this costs $2 less per Action card you have in play, but not less than $0.

Prosperity.name: Platinum
Prosperity.desc: Worth $5

Prosperity.name: Colony
Prosperity.desc: 10 Victory Points

Nocturne.name: Druid
Nocturne.desc: +1 Buy Receive one of the set aside, Boons, leaving it there. Setup: Set aside the top 3 Boons, face-up.

Nocturne.name: Faithful Hound
Nocturne.desc: +2 Cards When you discard this other than during Clean-up, you may set it aside, and put it into your hand at end of turn.

Nocturne.name: Guardian
Nocturne.desc: Until your next turn, when another player plays an Attack card, it doesn’t affect you. At the start of your next turn, +$1. This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

Nocturne.name: Monastery
Nocturne.desc: For each card you’ve gained this turn, you may trash a card from your hand or a Copper you have in play.

Nocturne.name: Pixie
Nocturne.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Discard the top Boon. You may trash this to receive that Boon twice. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Goat)

Nocturne.name: Goat
Nocturne.desc: Worth $1 When you play this, you may trash a card from your hand.

Nocturne.name: Tracker
Nocturne.desc: +$1. Receive a Boon. While this is in play, when you gain a card, you may put that card onto your deck. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Pouch)

Nocturne.name: Pouch
Nocturne.desc: $1 +1 Buy

Nocturne.name: Changeling
Nocturne.desc: $3 Night Trash this. Gain a copy of a card you have in play. In games using this, when you gain a card costing $3 or more, you may exchange it for a Changeling.

Nocturne.name: Fool
Nocturne.desc: If you aren’t the player with Lost in the Woods, take it, take 3 Boons, and receive the Boons in any order. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Lucky Coin)

Nocturne.name: Lucky Coin
Nocturne.desc: Worth $1 When you play this, gain a Silver.

Nocturne.name: Ghost Town
Nocturne.desc: At the start of your next turn, +1 Card and +1 Action. This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

Nocturne.name: Leprechaun
Nocturne.desc: Gain a Gold. If you have exactly 7 cards, gain a Wish from its pile. Otherwise, receive a Hex.

Nocturne.name: Night Watchman
Nocturne.desc: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, discard any number, and put the rest back in any order. This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

Nocturne.name: Secret Cave
Nocturne.desc: +1 Card +1 Action You may discard 3 cards. If you did, then at the start of your next turn: +$3. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Magic Lamp)

Nocturne.name: Magic Lamp
Nocturne.desc: $1 When you play this, if there are at least 6 cards that you have exactly 1 copy of in play, trash this. If you do, gain 3 Wishes from their pile.

Nocturne.name: Bard
Nocturne.desc: +$2 Receive a Boon.

Nocturne.name: Blessed Village
Nocturne.desc: +1 Card +1 Action When you gain this, take a Boon. Receive it now or at the start of your next turn.

Nocturne.name: Cemetery
Nocturne.desc: Worth 2VP When you gain this, trash up to 4 cards from your hand. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Haunted Mirror)

Nocturne.name: Haunted Mirror
Nocturne.desc: Worth $1 When you trash this, you may discard an Action card, to gain a Ghost from its pile.

Nocturne.name: Conclave
Nocturne.desc: +$2. You may play an Action card from your hand that you don’t have a copy of in play. If you do, +1 Action.

Nocturne.name: Devil’s Workshop
Nocturne.desc: If the number of cards you gained this turn is: 2+, gain an Imp from its pile; 1, gain a card costing up to $4; 0 gain a Gold.

Nocturne.name: Imp
Nocturne.desc: +2 Cards You may play an Action card from your hand that you don’t have a copy of in play. (This is not in the supply).

Nocturne.name: Exorcist
Nocturne.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a cheaper Spirit from one of the Spirit Piles.

Nocturne.name: Necromancer
Nocturne.desc: Play a face-up non-Duration Action card from the trash leaving it there and turning it face down for the turn. Setup: Put the 3 Zombies into the trash.

Nocturne.name: Zombie Apprentice
Nocturne.desc: You may trash an Action card from your hand for +3 Cards and +1 Action.

Nocturne.name: Zombie Mason
Nocturne.desc: Trash the top card of your deck. You may gain a card costing up to $1 more than it.

Nocturne.name: Zombie Spy
Nocturne.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Look at the top card of your deck. Discard it or put it back.

Nocturne.name: Shepherd
Nocturne.desc: +1 Action Discard any number of Victory cards, revealing them. +2 Cards per card discarded. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Pasture)

Nocturne.name: Pasture
Nocturne.desc: Worth $1 Worth 1VP per Estate you have.

Nocturne.name: Skulk
Nocturne.desc: +1 Buy Each other player receives the next Hex. When you gain this, gain a Gold.

Nocturne.name: Cobbler
Nocturne.desc: At the start of your next turn, gain a card to hand costing up to $4.

Nocturne.name: Crypt
Nocturne.desc: Set aside any number of Treasures you have in play (under this). While any remain, at the start of each of your turns, put one of them into your hand.

Nocturne.name: Cursed Village
Nocturne.desc: +2 Actions Draw until you have 6 cards in hand. When you gain this, receive a Hex.

Nocturne.name: Den of Sin
Nocturne.desc: At the start of your next turn: +2 Cards. This is gained to your hand (instead of your discard pile).

Nocturne.name: Idol
Nocturne.desc: When you play this, if you then have an odd number of Idols in play, receive a Boon; if an even number, each other player gains a Curse.

Nocturne.name: Pooka
Nocturne.desc: You may trash a Treasure other than Cursed Gold from your hand for +4 Cards. (When this is in the supply each player replaces one starting copper with Heirloom: Cursed Gold)

Nocturne.name: Cursed Gold
Nocturne.desc: Worth $3 When you play this, gain a Curse.

Nocturne.name: Sacred Grove
Nocturne.desc: +1 Buy +$3 Receive a Boon. If it doesn’t give +$1, each other player may receive it.

Nocturne.name: Tormentor
Nocturne.desc: +$2 If you have no other cards in play, gain an Imp from its pile. Otherwise, each other player receives the next Hex.

Nocturne.name: Tragic Hero
Nocturne.desc: +3 Cards +1 Buy If you have 8 or more cards in hand (after drawing), trash this and gain a Treasure.

Nocturne.name: Vampire
Nocturne.desc: Each other player receives the next Hex. Gain a card costing up to $5 other than a Vampire. Exchange this for a Bat.

Nocturne.name: Bat
Nocturne.desc: Trash up to 2 cards from your hand. If you trashed at least one, exchange this for a Vampire. (This is not in the Supply.)

Nocturne.name: Werewolf
Nocturne.desc: If it’s your Night phase, each other player receives the next Hex. Otherwise, +3 Cards.

Nocturne.name: Raider
Nocturne.desc: Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand discards a copy of a card you have in play (or reveals they can’t). At the start of your next turn, +$3

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Cellar
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Action Discard any number of cards, then draw that many.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Chapel
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Trash up to 4 cards from your hand.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Moat
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Cards When another player plays an Attack card, you may first reveal this from your hand, to be unaffected by it.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Harbinger
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Look through your discard pile. You may put a card from it onto your deck.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Merchant
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action The first time you play a Silver this turn, +$1.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Vassal
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Discard the top card of your deck. If it’s an Action card, you may play it.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Village
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Workshop
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Gain a card costing up to $4.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Bureaucrat
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Gain a silver card; put it on top of your deck. Each other player reveals a Victory card from his hand and puts it on his deck (or reveals a hand with no Victory cards).

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Gardens
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Worth 1 Victory for every 10 cards in your deck (rounded down).

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Militia
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +$2 Each other player discards down to 3 cards in their hand.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Moneylender
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: You may trash a Copper from your hand. If you do, +$3.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Poacher
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 Discard a card per empty Supply pile.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Remodel
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $2 more than the trashed card.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Smithy
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +3 Cards.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Throne Room
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: You may play an Action card from your hand twice.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Bandit
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Gain a Gold. Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes a revealed Treasure other than Copper, and discards the rest.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Council Room
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +4 Cards +1 Buy Each other player draws a card.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Festival
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Actions +1 Buy +$2.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Laboratory
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Cards +1 Action.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Library
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Draw until you have 7 cards in hand, skipping any Action cards you choose to; set those aside, discarding them afterwards.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Market
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +1 Buy +$1.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Mine
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: You may trash a Treasure from your hand. Gain a Treasure to your hand costing up to $3 more than it.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Sentry
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Trash and/or discard any number of them. Put the rest back on top in any order.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Witch
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Cards Each other player gains a Curse card.

Dominion 2nd Edition.name: Artisan
Dominion 2nd Edition.desc: Gain a card to your hand costing up to $5. Put a card from your hand onto your deck.

Alchemy.name: Herbalist
Alchemy.desc: +1 Buy +$1 When you discard this from play, you may put one of your Treasures from play onto your deck.

Alchemy.name: Apprentice
Alchemy.desc: +1 Action Trash a card from your hand. +1 Card per $1 it costs. +2 Cards if it has {{POTION}} in its cost.

Alchemy.name: Transmute
Alchemy.desc: Trash a card from your hand. If it’s an… Action card, gain a Duchy Treasure card, gain a Transmute Victory card, gain a Gold

Alchemy.name: Vineyard
Alchemy.desc: Worth 1 Victory Point per 3 Action cards in your deck (round down).

Alchemy.name: Apothecary
Alchemy.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Coppers and Potions into your hand. Put the rest back in any order.

Alchemy.name: Scrying Pool
Alchemy.desc: +1 Action Each player (including you) reveals the top card of their deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice. Then reveal cards from your deck until revealing one that isn’t an Action. Put all of those revealed cards into your hand.

Alchemy.name: University
Alchemy.desc: +2 Actions You may gain an Action card costing up to $5.

Alchemy.name: Alchemist
Alchemy.desc: +2 Card +1 Action When you discard this from play, if you have a Potion in play, you may put this onto your deck.

Alchemy.name: Familiar
Alchemy.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Each other player gains a curse.

Alchemy.name: Philosopher’s Stone
Alchemy.desc: When you play this, count your deck and discard pile. Worth $1 per 5 cards total between them (round down).

Alchemy.name: Golem
Alchemy.desc: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 2 Action cards other than Golems. Discard the other cards, then play the Action cards in either order.

Alchemy.name: Possession
Alchemy.desc: The player to your left takes an extra turn after this one, in which you can see all cards they can and make all decisions for them. Any cards or tokens they would gain on that turn, you gain instead; any cards of theirs that are trashed are set aside and put in their discard pile at end of turn.

Adventures: Events.name: Alms
Adventures: Events.desc: Once per turn: If you have no Treasures in play, gain a card costing up to $4.

Adventures: Events.name: Borrow
Adventures: Events.desc: Once per turn: +1 Buy. If your -1 Card token isn’t on your deck, put it there and +$1.

Adventures: Events.name: Quest
Adventures: Events.desc: You may discard an Attack, two Curses, or six cards. If you do, gain a Gold.

Adventures: Events.name: Save
Adventures: Events.desc: Once per turn: +1 Buy. Set aside a card from your hand, and put it into your hand at end of turn (after drawing).

Adventures: Events.name: Scouting Party
Adventures: Events.desc: +1 Buy Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Discard 3 and put the rest back in any order.

Adventures: Events.name: Travelling Fair
Adventures: Events.desc: +2 Buys When you gain a card this turn, you may put it onto your deck.

Adventures: Events.name: Bonfire
Adventures: Events.desc: Trash up to 2 cards you have in play.

Adventures: Events.name: Expedition
Adventures: Events.desc: Draw 2 extra cards for your next hand.

Adventures: Events.name: Ferry
Adventures: Events.desc: Move your -$2 cost token to an Action Supply pile. (Cards from that pile cost $2 less on your turns, but not less than $0.)

Adventures: Events.name: Plan
Adventures: Events.desc: Move your Trashing token to an Action Supply pile (when you buy a card from that pile, you may trash a card from your hand.))

Adventures: Events.name: Mission
Adventures: Events.desc: Once per turn: If the previous turn wasn’t yours, take another turn after this one, during which you can’t buy cards.

Adventures: Events.name: Pilgrimage
Adventures: Events.desc: Once per turn: Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up); then if it’s face up, choose up to 3 differently named cards you have in play and gain a copy of each.

Adventures: Events.name: Ball
Adventures: Events.desc: Take your -$1 token. Gain 2 cards each costing up to $4.

Adventures: Events.name: Raid
Adventures: Events.desc: Gain a Silver per Silver you have in play. Each other player puts their -1 Card token on their deck.

Adventures: Events.name: Seaway
Adventures: Events.desc: Gain an Action card costing up to $4. Move your +1 Buy token to its pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Buy.)

Adventures: Events.name: Trade
Adventures: Events.desc: Trash up to 2 cards from your hand. Gain a Silver per card you trashed.

Adventures: Events.name: Lost Arts
Adventures: Events.desc: Move your +1 Action token to an Action Supply pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Action.)

Adventures: Events.name: Training
Adventures: Events.desc: Move your +$1 token to an Action Supply pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +$1.)

Adventures: Events.name: Inheritance
Adventures: Events.desc: Once per game: Set aside a non-Victory Action card from the Supply costing up to $4. Move your Estate token to it. (Your Estates gain the abilities and types of that card.)

Adventures: Events.name: Pathfinding
Adventures: Events.desc: Move your +1 Card token to an Action Supply pile. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get +1 Card.)

Adventures: Events.name: Treasure Hunter
Adventures: Events.desc: +1 Action +$1 Gain a Silver per card the player to your right gained on their last turn. When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Warrior. (This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Warrior
Adventures: Events.desc: +2 Cards For each Traveller you have in play (including this), each other player discards the top card of their deck and trashes it if it costs $3 or $4. When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Hero. (This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Hero
Adventures: Events.desc: +$2 Gain a Treasure. When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Champion. (This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Champion
Adventures: Events.desc: +1 Action For the rest of the game, when another player plays an Attack, it doesn’t affect you, and when you play an Action, +1 Action. (This stays in play. This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Soldier
Adventures: Events.desc: +$2 +$1 per other Attack you have in play. Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand discards a card. When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Fugitive. (This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Fugitive
Adventures: Events.desc: +2 Cards +1 Action Discard a card. When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Disciple. (This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Disciple
Adventures: Events.desc: You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Gain a copy of it. When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Teacher. (This is not in the Supply.)

Adventures: Events.name: Teacher
Adventures: Events.desc: Put this on your Tavern mat. At the start of your turn, you may call this, to move your +1 Card, +1 Action, +1 Buy, or +$1 token to an Action Supply pile you have no tokens on. (When you play a card from that pile, you first get that bonus.) (This is not in the Supply.)

Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.name: Secret Chamber
Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.desc: Discard any number of cards. +$1 per card discarded. When another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, +2 cards, then put 2 cards from your hand on top of your deck.

Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.name: Coppersmith
Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.desc: Copper produces an extra $1 this turn.

Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.name: Scout
Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.desc: +1 Action Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Victory cards into your hand. Put the other cards on top of your deck in any order.

Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.name: Saboteur
Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.desc: Each other player reveals cards from the top of his deck until revealing one costing $3 or more. He trashes that card and may gain a card costing at most $2 less than it. He discards the other revealed cards.

Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.name: Tribute
Cards Removed From Intrigue 1st Edition.desc: The player to your left reveals then discards the top 2 cards of his deck. For each differently named card revealed, if it is an… Action Card; +2 Actions; Treasure Card; +$2; Victory Card; +2 Cards.

Dark Ages.name: Poor House
Dark Ages.desc: +$4 Reveal your hand. -$1 per Treasure card in your hand. (You can’t go below $0.)

Dark Ages.name: Beggar
Dark Ages.desc: Gain 3 Coppers to your hand. When another player plays an Attack card, you may first discard this to gain 2 Silvers, putting one onto your deck.

Dark Ages.name: Squire
Dark Ages.desc: +$1 Choose one: +2 Actions; or +2 Buys; or gain a Silver. ___ When you trash this, gain an Attack card.

Dark Ages.name: Vagrant
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Reveal the top card of your deck. If it’s a Curse, Ruins, Shelter, or Victory card, put it into your hand.

Dark Ages.name: Forager
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Action +1 Buy Trash a card from your hand, then +$1 per differently named Treasure in the trash.

Dark Ages.name: Hermit
Dark Ages.desc: Look through your discard pile. You may trash a non-Treasure card from your discard pile or hand. Gain a card costing up to $3. When you discard this from play, if you didn’t buy any cards this turn, trash this and gain a Madman from the Madman pile.

Dark Ages.name: Madman
Dark Ages.desc: +2 Actions Return this to the Madman pile. If you do, +1 Card per card in your hand. (This is not in the Supply.)

Dark Ages.name: Market Square
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +1 Buy When one of your cards is trashed, you may discard this from your hand to gain a Gold.

Dark Ages.name: Sage
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Action Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal one costing $3 or more. Put that card into your hand and discard the rest.

Dark Ages.name: Storeroom
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Buy Discard any number of cards, then draw that many. Then discard any number of cards for +$1 each.

Dark Ages.name: Urchin
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Each other player discards down to 4 cards in hand. When you play another Attack card with this in play, you may first trash this, to gain a Mercenary from the Mercenary pile.

Dark Ages.name: Mercenary
Dark Ages.desc: You may trash 2 cards from your hand. If you do, +2 Cards, + $2, and each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. (This is not in the Supply.)

Dark Ages.name: Armory
Dark Ages.desc: Gain a card onto your deck costing up to $4.

Dark Ages.name: Death Cart
Dark Ages.desc: +$5 You may trash an Action card from your hand. If you don’t, trash this. ___ When you gain this, gain two Ruins.

Dark Ages.name: Feodum
Dark Ages.desc: Worth 1 VP per 3 Silvers you have (round down). When you trash this, gain 3 Silvers.

Dark Ages.name: Fortress
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions ___ When you trash this, put it into your hand.

Dark Ages.name: Ironmonger
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Reveal the top card of your deck; you may discard it. Either way, if it’s an… Action card, +1 Action Treasure card, +$1 Victory card, +1 Card

Dark Ages.name: Marauder
Dark Ages.desc: Gain a Spoils from the Spoils pile. Each other player gains a Ruins.

Dark Ages.name: Procession
Dark Ages.desc: You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Trash it. Gain an Action card costing exactly $1 more than it.

Dark Ages.name: Rats
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Gain a Rats. Trash a card from your hand other than a Rats (or reveal a hand of all Rats). When you trash this, +1 Card.

Dark Ages.name: Scavenger
Dark Ages.desc: +$2 You may put your deck into your discard pile. Look through your discard pile and put one card from it onto your deck.

Dark Ages.name: Wandering Minstrel
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Put the Actions back on top in any order and discard the rest.

Dark Ages.name: Band of Misfits
Dark Ages.desc: Play this as if it were a cheaper Action card in the Supply. This is that card until it leaves play.

Dark Ages.name: Bandit Camp
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions Gain a Spoils from the Spoils pile.

Dark Ages.name: Catacombs
Dark Ages.desc: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Choose one: Put them into your hand; or discard them and +3 Cards. ___ When you trash this, gain a cheaper card.

Dark Ages.name: Count
Dark Ages.desc: Choose one: Discard 2 cards; or put a card from your hand onto your deck; or gain a Copper. Choose one: +$3; trash your hand; or gain a Duchy.

Dark Ages.name: Counterfeit
Dark Ages.desc: $1 +1 Buy When you play this, you may play a treasure from your hand twice. If you do, trash that treasure.

Dark Ages.name: Cultist
Dark Ages.desc: +2 Cards Each other player gains a Ruins. You may play a Cultist from your hand. ___ When you trash this, +3 Cards.

Dark Ages.name: Graverobber
Dark Ages.desc: Choose one: Gain a card from the trash costing from $3 to $6, onto your deck; or trash an Action card from your hand and gain a card costing up to $3 more than it.

Dark Ages.name: Junk Dealer
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 Trash a card from your hand.

Dark Ages.name: Mystic
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Action +$2 Name a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If you named it, put it into your hand.

Dark Ages.name: Pillage
Dark Ages.desc: Trash this. Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand reveals their hand and discards a card that you choose. Gain 2 Spoils from the Spoils pile.

Dark Ages.name: Rebuild
Dark Ages.desc: +1 Action Name a card. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Victory card you did not name. Discard the rest, trash the Victory card, and gain a Victory card costing up to $3 more than it..

Dark Ages.name: Rogue
Dark Ages.desc: +$2 If there are any cards in the trash costing from $3 to $6, gain one of them. Otherwise, each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest.

Dark Ages.name: Altar
Dark Ages.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $5.

Dark Ages.name: Hunting Grounds
Dark Ages.desc: +4 Cards When you trash this, gain a Duchy or 3 Estates.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Dame Anna
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: You may trash up to 2 cards from your hand. Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Dame Josephine
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this. Worth 2 VP

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Dame Molly
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: +2 Actions. Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Dame Natalie
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: You may gain a card costing up to $3. Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Dame Sylvia
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: +$2 Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Sir Bailey
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Sir Destry
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: +2 Cards Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Sir Martin
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: +2 Buys Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Sir Michael
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: Each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this.

Dark Ages: Knights.name: Sir Vander
Dark Ages: Knights.desc: Each other player reveals the top two cards of their deck, trashes one of them costing from $3 to $6, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this. When you trash this, gain a Gold.

Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.name: Wish
Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.desc: +1 Action Return this to its pile. If you did, gain a card to your hand costing up to $6. (This is not in the Supply.)

Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.name: Will-O’-Wisp
Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Reveal the top card of your deck. If it costs $2 or less, put it into your hand. (This is not in the Supply.)

Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.name: Imp
Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.desc: +2 Cards You may play an Action card from your hand that you don’t have a copy of in play. (This is not in the supply).

Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.name: Ghost
Nocturne Spirits and Wishes.desc: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal an Action. Discard the other cards and set aside the Action. At the start of your next turn, play it twice. (This is not in the Supply.)

Cornucopia.name: Hamlet
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Card +1 Action You may discard a card for +1 Action. You may discard a card for +1 Buy.

Cornucopia.name: Fortune Teller
Cornucopia.desc: +$2 Each other player reveals cards from the top of their deck until they reveal a Victory card or Curse. They put it on top and discard the rest.

Cornucopia.name: Menagerie
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Action Reveal your hand. If the revealed cards all have different names, +3 Cards. Otherwise, +1 Card.

Cornucopia.name: Farming Village
Cornucopia.desc: +2 Actions Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal an Action or Treasure card. Put that card into your hand and discard the rest.

Cornucopia.name: Horse Traders
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Buy +$3 Discard 2 cards. When another player plays an Attack card, you may first set this aside from your hand. If you do, then at the start of your next turn, +1 Card and return this to your hand.

Cornucopia.name: Remake
Cornucopia.desc: Do this twice: Trash a card from your hand, then gain a card costing exactly $1 more than it.

Cornucopia.name: Tournament
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Action Each player may reveal a Province from their hand. If you do, discard it and gain any Prize (from the Prize pile) or a Duchy, onto your deck. If no-one else does, +1 Card and +$1.

Cornucopia.name: Young Witch
Cornucopia.desc: +2 Cards Discard 2 cards. Each other player may reveal a Bane card from their hand; if they don’t, they gain a Curse. Setup: Add an extra Kingdom card pile costing $2 or $3 to the Supply. Cards from that pile are Bane cards.

Cornucopia.name: Harvest
Cornucopia.desc: Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck, then discard them. +$1 per differently named card revealed.

Cornucopia.name: Horn of Plenty
Cornucopia.desc: Worth $0. When you play this, gain a card costing up to $1 per differently named card you have in play (counting this). If it’s a Victory card, trash this.

Cornucopia.name: Hunting Party
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Card +1 Action. Reveal your hand. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal one that isn’t a copy of one in your hand. Put it into your hand and discard the rest.

Cornucopia.name: Jester
Cornucopia.desc: +$2 Each other player discards the top card of their deck. If it’s a Victory card they gain a Curse; otherwise they gain a copy of the discarded card or you do, your choice.

Cornucopia.name: Fairgrounds
Cornucopia.desc: Worth 2VP for every 5 differently named cards in your deck (round down).

Cornucopia.name: Bag of Gold
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Action Gain a Gold onto your deck. (This is not in the Supply.)

Cornucopia.name: Diadem
Cornucopia.desc: Worth $2. When you play this, +$1 per unused Action you have (Action, not Action card). (This is not in the Supply.)

Cornucopia.name: Followers
Cornucopia.desc: +2 Cards Gain an Estate. Each other player gains a Curse and discards down to 3 cards in hand. (This is not in the Supply.)

Cornucopia.name: Princess
Cornucopia.desc: +1 Buy While this is in play, cards cost $2 less, but not less than $0. (This is not in the Supply.)

Cornucopia.name: Trusty Steed
Cornucopia.desc: Choose two: +2 Cards; +2 Actions; +$2; gain 4 Silvers and put your deck into your discard pile.

Promotional Cards.name: Black Market
Promotional Cards.desc: +$2 Reveal the top 3 cards of the Black Market deck. Play any number of Treasures from your hand. You may buy one of the revealed cards. Put the rest on the bottom of the Black Market deck in any order. Setup: Make a Black Market deck out of different unused Kingdom cards.

Promotional Cards.name: Dismantle
Promotional Cards.desc: Trash a card from your hand. If it costs $1 or more, gain a cheaper card and a Gold.

Promotional Cards.name: Envoy
Promotional Cards.desc: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. The player to your left chooses one. Discard that one and put the rest into your hand.

Promotional Cards.name: Sauna
Promotional Cards.desc: +1 Card +1 Action You may play an Avanto from your hand While this is in play, when you play a Silver, you may trash a card from your hand. (This is the top half of the Sauna/Avanto pile.)

Promotional Cards.name: Avanto
Promotional Cards.desc: + 3 Cards You may play a Sauna from your hand (This is the bottom half of the Sauna/Avanto pile.)

Promotional Cards.name: Walled Village
Promotional Cards.desc: +1 Card; +2 Actions At the start of Clean-up, if you have this and no more than one other Action card in play, you may put this onto your deck.

Promotional Cards.name: Governor
Promotional Cards.desc: +1 Action Choose one; you get the version in parentheses: Each player gets +1 (+3) Cards; or each player gains a Silver (Gold); or each player may trash a card from their hand and gain a card costing exactly $1 ($2) more.

Promotional Cards.name: Stash
Promotional Cards.desc: Worth $2 When shuffling this, you may look through your remaining deck, and may put this anywhere in the shuffled cards.

Promotional Cards.name: Summon
Promotional Cards.desc: Gain an Action card costing up to $4. Set it aside. If you did, then at the start of your next turn, play it.

Promotional Cards.name: Prince
Promotional Cards.desc: You may set this aside. If you do, set aside an Action card from your hand costing up to $4. At the start of each of your turns, play that Action, setting it aside again when you discard it from play. (Stop playing it if you fail to set it aside on a turn you play it.)

Empires: Events.name: Advance
Empires: Events.desc: You may trash an Action card from your hand. If you do, gain an Action card costing up to $6.

Empires: Events.name: Triumph
Empires: Events.desc: Gain an Estate. If you did, +1 VP per card you’ve gained this turn.

Empires: Events.name: Annex
Empires: Events.desc: Look through your discard pile. Choose up to 5 cards from it and shuffle the rest into your deck. Gain a Duchy.

Empires: Events.name: Donate
Empires: Events.desc: After this turn, put all cards from your deck and discard pile into your hand, trash any number, shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

Empires: Events.name: Tax
Empires: Events.desc: Add [2D] to a Supply pile. Setup: Add [1D] to each Supply pile. When a player buys a card, they take the [D] from its pile.

Empires: Events.name: Banquet
Empires: Events.desc: Gain two Coppers and a non-Victory card costing up to $5..

Empires: Events.name: Ritual
Empires: Events.desc: Gain a Curse. If you do, trash a card from your hand. +1 VP per $1 it cost.

Empires: Events.name: Salt the Earth
Empires: Events.desc: +1 VP Trash a Victory card from the Supply.

Empires: Events.name: Windfall
Empires: Events.desc: If your deck and discard pile are empty, gain 3 Golds.

Empires: Events.name: Conquest
Empires: Events.desc: Gain 2 Silvers. +1 VP per Silver you’ve gained this turn.

Empires: Events.name: Dominate
Empires: Events.desc: Gain a Province. If you do, +9 VP.

Seaside.name: Embargo
Seaside.desc: +$2 Trash this. Add an Embargo token to a Supply pile. (For the rest of the game, when a player buys a card from that pile, they gain a Curse.)

Seaside.name: Haven
Seaside.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Set aside a card from your hand face down (under this). At the start of your next turn, put it into your hand.

Seaside.name: Lighthouse
Seaside.desc: +1 Action Now and at the start of your next turn: +$1. While this is in play, when another player plays an Attack card, it doesn’t affect you.

Seaside.name: Native Village
Seaside.desc: +2 Actions Choose one: Put the top card of your deck face down on your Native Village mat (you may look at those cards at any time); or put all the cards from your mat into your hand.

Seaside.name: Pearl Diver
Seaside.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Look at the bottom card of your deck. You may put it on top.

Seaside.name: Ambassador (part II)
Seaside.desc: Reveal a card from your hand. Return up to 2 copies of it from your hand to the Supply. Then each other player gains a copy of it.

Seaside.name: Fishing Village
Seaside.desc: +2 Actions +$1 At the start of your next turn: +1 Action and +$1.

Seaside.name: Lookout
Seaside.desc: +1 Action Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash one of them. Discard one of them. Put the other one back on to your deck.

Seaside.name: Smugglers
Seaside.desc: Gain a copy of a card costing up to $6 that the player to your right gained on their last turn.

Seaside.name: Warehouse
Seaside.desc: +3 Cards +1 Action Discard 3 cards.

Seaside.name: Caravan
Seaside.desc: +1 Card +1 Action At the start of your next turn, +1 Card.

Seaside.name: Cutpurse
Seaside.desc: +$2 Each other player discards a Copper (or reveals a hand with no Copper).

Seaside.name: Island
Seaside.desc: Put this and a card from your hand onto your Island mat. 2 Victory Points

Seaside.name: Navigator
Seaside.desc: +$2 Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Either discard them all, or put them back in any order.

Seaside.name: Pirate Ship
Seaside.desc: Choose one: +$1 per Coin token on your Pirate Ship mat; or each other player reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, trashes one of those Treasures that you choose, and discards the rest, and then if anyone trashed a Treasure you add a Coin token to your Pirate Ship mat.

Seaside.name: Salvager
Seaside.desc: +1 Buy Trash a card from your hand. +$1 per $1 it costs.

Seaside.name: Sea Hag
Seaside.desc: Each other player discards the top card of their deck, then gains a Curse onto their deck.

Seaside.name: Treasure Map
Seaside.desc: Trash this and a Treasure Map from your hand. If you trashed two Treasure Maps, gain 4 Golds onto your deck.

Seaside.name: Bazaar
Seaside.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions +$1.

Seaside.name: Explorer
Seaside.desc: You may reveal a Province from your hand. If you do, gain a Gold to your hand. If you don’t, gain a Silver to your hand.

Seaside.name: Ghost Ship
Seaside.desc: +2 Cards Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand puts cards from their hand onto their deck until they have 3 cards in hand.

Seaside.name: Merchant Ship
Seaside.desc: Now and at the start of your next turn: +$2.

Seaside.name: Outpost
Seaside.desc: If this is the first time you played an Outpost this turn, and the previous turn wasn’t yours, then take an extra turn after this one, and you only draw 3 cards for your next hand.

Seaside.name: Tactician
Seaside.desc: If you have at least one card in hand, discard your hand, and at the start of your next turn, +5 Cards, +1 Action, and +1 Buy.

Seaside.name: Treasury
Seaside.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 When you discard this from play, if you didn’t buy a Victory card this turn, you may put this onto your deck.

Seaside.name: Wharf
Seaside.desc: Now and at the start of your next turn: +2 Cards and +1 Buy.

Adventures.name: Coin of the Realm
Adventures.desc: Worth $1 When you play this, put it on your Tavern mat. Directly after you finish playing an Action card, you may call this, for +2 Actions.

Adventures.name: Page
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +1 Action When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Treasure Hunter.

Adventures.name: Peasant
Adventures.desc: +1 Buy +$1 When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Soldier.

Adventures.name: Ratcatcher
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Put this on your Tavern mat. At the start of your turn, you may call this, to trash a card from your hand.

Adventures.name: Raze
Adventures.desc: +1 Action Trash this or a card from your hand. Look at one card from your deck per $1 the trashed card costs. Put one of them into your hand and discard the rest.

Adventures.name: Amulet
Adventures.desc: Now and at the start of your next turn, choose one: +$1; or trash a card from your hand; or gain a Silver.

Adventures.name: Caravan Guard
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +1 Action At the start of your next turn, +$1. When another player plays an Attack card, you may first play this from your hand. (+1 Action has no effect if it’s not your turn.)

Adventures.name: Dungeon
Adventures.desc: +1 Action Now and at the start of your next turn: +2 Cards, then discard 2 cards

Adventures.name: Gear
Adventures.desc: +2 Cards Set aside up to 2 cards from your hand face down (under this). At the start of your next turn, put them into your hand.

Adventures.name: Guide
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Put this on your Tavern mat. At the start of your turn, you may call this, to discard your hand and draw 5 cards.

Adventures.name: Duplicate
Adventures.desc: Put this on your Tavern mat. When you gain a card costing up to $6, you may call this, to gain a copy of that card.

Adventures.name: Magpie
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Reveal the top card of your deck. If it’s a Treasure, put it into your hand. If it’s an Action or Victory card, gain a Magpie.

Adventures.name: Messenger
Adventures.desc: +1 Buy +$2 You may put your deck into your discard pile. When this is your first buy in a turn, gain a card costing up to $4, and each other player gains a copy of it.

Adventures.name: Miser
Adventures.desc: Choose one: Put a Copper from your hand onto your Tavern mat; or +$1 per Copper on your Tavern mat.

Adventures.name: Port
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions When you buy this, gain another Port.

Adventures.name: Ranger
Adventures.desc: +1 Buy Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). Then if it’s face up, +5 Cards.

Adventures.name: Transmogrify
Adventures.desc: +1 Action. Put this on your Tavern mat. At the start of your turn, you may call this, to trash a card from your hand, and gain a card costing up to $1 more than it into your hand.

Adventures.name: Artificer
Adventures.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 Discard any number of cards. You may gain a card costing exactly $1 per card discarded, onto your deck.

Adventures.name: Bridge Troll
Adventures.desc: Each other player takes their -$1 token. Now and at the start of your next turn: +1 Buy. While this is in play, cards cost $1 less on your turns, but not less than $0.

Adventures.name: Distant Lands
Adventures.desc: Put this on your Tavern mat. Worth 4 VP if on your Tavern mat at the end of the game (otherwise worth 0 VP).

Adventures.name: Giant
Adventures.desc: Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). Then if it’s face down, +$1. If it’s face up, +$5, and each other player reveals the top card of their deck, trashes it if it costs from $3 to $6, and otherwise discards it and gains a Curse.

Adventures.name: Haunted Woods
Adventures.desc: Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, they put their hand onto their deck in any order. At the start of your next turn, +3 Cards.

Adventures.name: Lost City
Adventures.desc: +2 Cards +2 Actions When you gain this, each other player draws a card.

Adventures.name: Relic
Adventures.desc: Worth $2 When you play this, each other player puts their -1 Card token on their deck.

Adventures.name: Royal Carriage
Adventures.desc: +1 Action Put this on your Tavern mat. Directly after you finish playing an Action card, if it’s still in play, you may call this, to replay that Action.

Adventures.name: Storyteller
Adventures.desc: +1 Action +$1 Play up to 3 Treasures from your hand. Then pay all of your $ (including the $1 from this) and draw a card per $1 you paid.

Adventures.name: Swamp Hag
Adventures.desc: Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, they gain a Curse. At the start of your next turn, +$3.

Adventures.name: Treasure Trove
Adventures.desc: Worth $2 When you play this, gain a Gold and a Copper.

Adventures.name: Wine Merchant
Adventures.desc: +$4 +1 Buy Put this on your Tavern mat. At the end of your Buy phase, if you have at least $2 unspent, you may discard this from your Tavern mat.

Adventures.name: Hireling
Adventures.desc: At the start of each of your turns for the rest of the game: +1 Card. (This stays in play.)

Dark Ages: Shelters.name: Hovel
Dark Ages: Shelters.desc: When you buy a Victory card, you may trash this from your hand.

Dark Ages: Shelters.name: Overgrown Estate
Dark Ages: Shelters.desc: 0 VP ___ When you trash this, +1 Card.

Dark Ages: Ruins.name: Survivors
Dark Ages: Ruins.desc: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Discard them or put them back in any order.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Courtyard
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +3 Cards Put a card from your hand onto your deck.
+1 Action Choose one: Trash an Action card from the Supply; or gain an Action card from the trash.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Pawn
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Choose two: +1 Card; +1 Action; +1 Buy; +$1. The choices must be different.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Masquerade
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Cards Each player with any cards in hand passes one to the next such player to their left, at once. Then you may trash a card from your hand.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Shanty Town
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Actions Reveal your hand. If you have no Action cards in hand, +2 Cards.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Steward
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Choose one: +2 Cards; or +$2; or trash 2 cards from your hand.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Swindler
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +$2 Each other player trashes the top card of their deck and gains a card with the same cost that you choose.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Wishing Well
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card; +1 Action Name a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If you name it, put it in your hand.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Baron
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Buy You may discard an Estate for +$4. If you don’t gain an Estate.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Bridge
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Buy +$1 This turn, cards (everywhere) cost $1 less, but not less than $0.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Conspirator
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +$2 If you’ve played 3 or more Actions this turn (counting this), +1 Card and +1 Action.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Diplomat
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Cards If you have 5 or fewer cards in hand (after drawing), +2 Actions. When another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from a hand of 5 or more cards, to draw 2 cards then discard 3.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Ironworks
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Gain a card costing up to $4. If the gained card is an… Action card, +1 Action Treasure card, +$1 Victory card, +1 Card

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Mill
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action You may discard 2 cards, for +$2. 1 VP

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Mining Village
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions You may trash this for +$2.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Secret Passage
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +2 Cards +1 Action Take a card from your hand and put it anywhere in your deck.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Courtier
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Reveal a card from your hand. For each type it has (Action, Attack, etc.), choose one: +1 Action; or +1 Buy; or +$3; or gain a Gold. The choices must be different.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Duke
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Worth 1 Victory Point per Duchy you have.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Minion
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Action Choose one: +$2; or discard your hand, +4 Cards, and each other player with at least 5 cards in hand discards their hand and draws 4 cards.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Patrol
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +3 Cards Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the Victory cards and Curses into your hand. Put the rest back in any order.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Replace
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to $2 more than it. If the gained card is an Action or Treasure, put it onto your deck; if it’s a Victory card, each other player gains a Curse.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Torturer
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +3 Cards Each other player either discards 2 cards or gains a Curse to their hand, their choice. (They may pick an option they can’t do.)

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Trading Post
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Trash 2 cards from your hand. If you did, gain a Silver to your hand.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Upgrade
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing exactly $1 more than it.

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Harem
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: $2 2 Victory Points

Intrigue 2nd Edition.name: Nobles
Intrigue 2nd Edition.desc: Choose one: +3 Cards; or +2 Actions. 2 Victory Points

Castles.name: Humble Castle
Castles.desc: $1 Worth 1 VP per Castle you have.

Castles.name: Crumbling Castle
Castles.desc: 1 VP When you gain or trash this, +1 VP and gain a Silver.

Castles.name: Small Castle
Castles.desc: Trash this or a Castle from your hand. If you do, gain a Castle. 2 VP

Castles.name: Haunted Castle
Castles.desc: 2 VP When you gain this during your turn, gain a Gold, and each other player with 5 or more cards in hand puts 2 cards from their hand onto their deck.

Castles.name: Opulent Castle
Castles.desc: Discard any number of Victory cards. +$2 per card discarded. 3 VP

Castles.name: Sprawling Castle
Castles.desc: 4 VP When you gain this, gain a Duchy or 3 Estates.

Castles.name: Grand Castle
Castles.desc: 5 VP When you gain this, reveal your hand. +1 VP per Victory card in your hand and/or in play.

Castles.name: King’s Castle
Castles.desc: Worth 2 VP per Castle you have.

Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.name: Chancellor
Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.desc: +$2 You may immediately put your deck into your discard pile.

Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.name: Feast
Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.desc: Trash this card. Gain a card costing up to $5.

Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.name: Spy
Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.desc: +1 Card; +1 Action Each player (including you) reveals the top card of his deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice.

Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.name: Thief
Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.desc: Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck. If they revealed any Treasure cards, they trash one of them that you choose. You may gain any or all of these trashed cards. They discard the other revealed cards.

Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.name: Adventurer
Cards Removed From Dominion 1st Edition.desc: +1 Card; +1 Action Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Coppers and Potions into your hand. Put the other cards back on top in any order.

Hinterlands.name: Crossroads
Hinterlands.desc: Reveal your hand. +1 Card per Victory card revealed. If this is the first time you played a Crossroads this turn, +3 Actions.

Hinterlands.name: Duchess
Hinterlands.desc: +$2 Each player (including you) looks at the top card of their deck and may discard it. If Duchess is in the Supply, you may gain one when you gain a Duchy.

Hinterlands.name: Fool’s Gold
Hinterlands.desc: Worth $1 if it’s the first time you played a Fool’s Gold this turn, otherwise worth $4. When another player gains a Province, you may trash this from your hand, to gain a Gold onto your deck.

Hinterlands.name: Develop
Hinterlands.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain two cards onto your deck, with one costing exactly $1 more than it, and one costing exactly $1 less than it, in either order.

Hinterlands.name: Oasis
Hinterlands.desc: +1 Card +1 Action +$1 Discard a card.

Hinterlands.name: Oracle
Hinterlands.desc: Each player (including you) reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, and discards them or puts them back, your choice. They choose the order to return them. Afterwards, you draw 2 cards.

Hinterlands.name: Scheme
Hinterlands.desc: +1 Card +1 Action This turn, you may put one of your Action cards onto your deck when you discard it from play.

Hinterlands.name: Tunnel
Hinterlands.desc: 2 Victory Points When you discard this other than during Clean-up, you may reveal it to gain a Gold.

Hinterlands.name: Jack of All Trades
Hinterlands.desc: Gain a Silver. Look at the top card of your deck; you may discard it. Draw until you have 5 cards in hand. You may trash a non-Treasure card from your hand.

Hinterlands.name: Noble Brigand
Hinterlands.desc: +$1 When you buy or play this, each other player reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, trashes a revealed Silver or Gold you choose, discards the rest, and gains a Copper if they didn’t reveal a Treasure. You gain the trashed cards.

Hinterlands.name: Nomad Camp
Hinterlands.desc: +1 Buy +$2 This is gained onto your deck (instead of to your discard pile).

Hinterlands.name: Silk Road
Hinterlands.desc: Worth 1 Victory Point per 4 Victory cards you have (round down).

Hinterlands.name: Spice Merchant
Hinterlands.desc: You may trash a Treasure from your hand. If you do, choose one: +2 Cards and +1 Action; or +1 Buy and $2.

Hinterlands.name: Trader
Hinterlands.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain a Silver per $1 it costs. When you would gain a card, you may reveal this from your hand, to instead gain a Silver.

Hinterlands.name: Cache
Hinterlands.desc: Worth $3 When you gain this, gain 2 Coppers.

Hinterlands.name: Cartographer
Hinterlands.desc: +1 Card +1 Action Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Discard any number of them, then put the rest back in any order.

Hinterlands.name: Embassy
Hinterlands.desc: +5 Cards Discard 3 cards. When you gain this, each other player gains a Silver.

Hinterlands.name: Haggler
Hinterlands.desc: +$2 While this is in play, when you buy a card, gain a cheaper non-Victory card.

Hinterlands.name: Highway
Hinterlands.desc: +1 Card +1 Action While this is in play, cards cost $1 less, but not less than $0.

Hinterlands.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
Hinterlands.desc: Worth $1 When you play this, you may gain a Copper to your hand. When you gain this, each other player gains a Curse.

Hinterlands.name: Inn
Hinterlands.desc: +2 Cards; +2 Actions Discard 2 cards. When you gain this, look through your discard pile, reveal any number of Action cards from it (which can include this), and shuffle them into your deck.

Hinterlands.name: Mandarin
Hinterlands.desc: +$3 Put a card from your hand on top of your deck. When you gain this, put all Treasures you have in play onto your deck in any order.

Hinterlands.name: Margrave
Hinterlands.desc: +3 Cards +1 Buy Each other player draws a card, then discards down to 3 cards in hand.

Hinterlands.name: Stables
Hinterlands.desc: You may discard a Treasure, for +3 Cards and +1 Action.

Hinterlands.name: Border Village
Hinterlands.desc: +1 Card +2 Actions When you gain this, gain a cheaper card.

Hinterlands.name: Farmland
Hinterlands.desc: 2 VP When you buy this, trash a card from your hand and gain a card costing exactly $2 more than it. /td>

Dark Ages: Spoils.name: Spoils
Dark Ages: Spoils.desc: $3 When you play this, return it to the pile.

Guilds.name: Candlestick Maker
Guilds.desc: +1 Action. +1 Buy. Take a Coin token.

Guilds.name: Stonemason
Guilds.desc: Trash a card from your hand. Gain 2 cards each costing less than it. When you buy this, you may overpay for it. If you do, gain 2 Action cards each costing the amount you overpaid.

Guilds.name: Doctor
Guilds.desc: Name a card. Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash the matches. Put the rest in any order. When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look at the top card of your deck; trash it, discard it, or put it back.

Guilds.name: Masterpiece
Guilds.desc: Worth $1 When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look through your discard pile and put a card from it onto your deck..

Guilds.name: Advisor
Guilds.desc: +1 Action. Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. The player to your left chooses one of them. Discard that card and put the rest into your hand.

Guilds.name: Herald
Guilds.desc: +1 Card. +1 Action. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Action, play it. When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each $1 you overpaid, look through your discard pile and put a card from it onto your deck.

Guilds.name: Plaza
Guilds.desc: +1 Card. +2 Actions. You may discard a Treasure to take a Coin token.

Guilds.name: Baker
Guilds.desc: +1 Card. +1 Action. Take a Coin token. Setup: Each player takes a Coin token.

Guilds.name: Butcher
Guilds.desc: Take 2 Coin tokens. You may trash a card from your hand. If you do, pay any number of Coin tokens, and gain a card with a cost of up to the cost of the trashed card plus the number of Coin tokens you paid.

Guilds.name: Journeyman
Guilds.desc: Name a card. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 3 cards without that name. Put those cards into your hand and discard the rest.

Guilds.name: Merchant Guild
Guilds.desc: +1 Buy. +$1. While this is in play, when you buy a card, take a Coin token.

Guilds.name: Soothsayer
Guilds.desc: Gain a Gold. Each other player gains a Curse, and if they did, draws a card.
